SENT.plain: A registry of haematopoietic malignancies was established on January 1, 1980 in order to accurately determine the incidence and epidemiological features of these diseases in the department of CÃ´te d'Or (population 478,000)
Over five years (1980-1984), 704 new cases were recorded
The crude incidence rates were 32.7 per 100,000 for males and 24.9 per 100,000 for females
The corresponding age standardized rates were 26.4 and 16.7
In males, chronic lymphocytic leukaemias were the most common haematopoietic malignancies, followed by non Hodgkin's lymphomas, acute leukaemias and multiple myelomas
In females, multiple myelomas and acute leukaemias preceded non Hodgkin's lymphomas and chronic lymphocytic leukaemias
For men and women, the risk of haematopoietic malignancies was higher in urban areas than in rural areas
Compared to population based registries in other countries, incidence rates are among the highest reported and are particularly high for chronic lymphocytic leukaemia
